channel.title: Response Format :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Similar to an HTTP Request, an HTTP response is typically a stream of text and possibly data: It consists of one or more lines of text, terminated by a CRLF (sequential carriage return and line feed characters): A status-line indicating the HTTP protocol, the status code, and a textual status Optional lines containing the Response Headers. These specify the details of the response or describe the response body A blank line, indicating the end of the response metadata An optional response body. This will typically be the text of an HTML file, or binary data for an image or other file type, or a block of bytes for streaming data. The Status-Line The status-line follows the format
